episode_title: 414 - The One With Joey’s Dirty Day

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is getting ready for a fishing trip and Phoebe is asking him about the fishing lures. Ross is playing with the rod, and Monica is pretty much just watching the on goings.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So now, what is this now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Guggly worm.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And this?
content.parenthetical: laughs and picks up another lure

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Glow-pop giggly jammer.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You make it so funny.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey umm, what’s this?
content.parenthetical: not wanting to be left out, picks up something

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh, a hunk of sandwich from last year. (Monica drops the sandwich)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, Geller’s got one hooked! Ohh! Looks like a big one! Yeah, ohh! Ohh! (Swinging the rod back and forth) It’s the classic struggle between man and—(swings the rod and knocks over a lamp.) Someone knocked over a lamp.
content.parenthetical: pretend fishing in the living room

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s all right. Hey you guys, you know what’s going to be great about the fishing trip this year? When my dad gets me out in the middle of the lake and gives me that, “Joey, what are you doing with your life?” stuff. I can say, “Well, I’m doing a movie with Charlton Heston dad. What are you doing with your life?”
content.parenthetical: going over and picking up the rod

content.speaker: All
content.text: Great!
(Chandler enters from his bedroom, all depressed and wearing sweat pants, with the chick and duck in tow.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t have to stop having fun just because I’m here. Kathy didn’t cheat on all of you. (To Joey) Well, except you. (They hug and Chandler goes into the bathroom with the chick and duck following him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Joey, I don’t think that you should leave Chandler alone. I mean it’s only been two days since he broke up with Kathy. Maybe you can go fishing next week?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, there’s nothing I can do for him right now, he’s still in his sweat pants, that’s still Phase One. Y’know? I’ll be back for Phase Two, I would never miss Phase Two.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s Phase Two?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Gettin’ drunk and going to a strip club.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How does going to a strip club help him better?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because there are naked ladies there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Which helps him get to Phase Three, picturing yourself with other women.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There are naked ladies there too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Would you give me one minute!! Please.
content.parenthetical: opening the bathroom door and kicking out the chick and duck

content.description: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel is still dressing Joshua. He is trying on a pair of pants.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: So, these will match the jacket you picked out for me last week?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um-hmm. (Joshua turns to look in the mirror and leaves Rachel staring at his ass.) There we go. There it is.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Oh! You know what I need?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Gloves. Brown, leather dress gloves.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay. Uhh, well let’s see. (Grabs his hand.) You’re about—well uh, this one is large. And this one—(Grabs the other hand.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Also large?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Okay, two larges coming right up!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Rachel! Could I have a moment?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: I-I was wondering, my niece you see is in from London—well Shropshire really but y’know—well she’s about your age I say. Anyway I have tickets for the opera, Die Fledermaus, and I was wondering if you’d like to keep her company this evening?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure. You got it. Great!

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Oh, good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Me, Fledermaus, great. I really—(motions to Joshua.)

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Ohh! Yes of course, thank you, thank you, thank you so very much.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: So…(Holds out his hands as to say, “Where are my gloves?”)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So? (She puts her hands in his, totally forgetting about the gloves, and hoping for something more intimate.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Gloves?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! Right! Right, sorry, I’ll be right back!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Uhh, actually y’know what, I kinda—I have to take off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: But, I was curious; do you have any plans for tonight?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Nothing!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: I invested in this night-club and it’s opening tonight, would you like to come?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! That would be great!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: You’re into hardcore S&M right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I-I guess—I…

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Kidding! (Rachel is relived) I’m gonna get there early, but I’m going to put you on the V.I.P list, okay? Look for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, great, you betcha!

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: I almost forget the tickets, didn’t I?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: For you and Emily, tonight, Die Fledermaus.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Oh, right.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: I think you’ll like it, it has two out of the three tenors.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yay!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is in his sweats flinging playing cards into a pot.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I can’t believe Kathy did this too me. I really, thought that she was the one. I tell you what, from now on I’m never getting out of this chair, ever! Okay? From now on, this chair is the one! You wanna what else is the one? My sweat pants!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, man! Just-just take the sweats off. Okay? Just take ‘em off and we’ll have some fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Catch any big fish? (Phoebe, Ross, and Monica all go over to him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God, you guys have no idea.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh! God! Wow!
content.parenthetical: they all recoil from the smell emanating from him

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You stink!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you kidding?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, three days on the lake without a shower. Plus! I fell in that big tub of worms at the bait stand! Hey, how-how’s he doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He hasn’t gotten out of that chair in two days.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey buddy! How’s it going?
(Chandler imitates retching and gets out of the chair.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, see that? He just needed his pal to come home. All right, uh, I’ve got to go memorise my lines. (Starts to go his bedroom) Me and Charlton Heston bright and early tomorrow morning! Yeah-yeah!
content.parenthetical: To the rest of the gang

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-oh, what’s the matter?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, it’s Joshua invited me to this fancy club opening tonight. But, I already told Mr. Waltham that I would take his niece to this dumb old opera. So… What are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know sweetie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Help me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t! I have to work!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I would, but I get my morning sickness in the evening.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Unless! She wants to spend the night holding my hair back for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, gosh. You guys, come on, this is—I have to meet Joshua! This is my one chance for him to see the fun Rachel. Y’know the “Wouldn’t it be great if she was my wife” Rachel. Ohh, all right! Are Joey and Chandler back?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, Chandler’s still in Phase One, and Joey’s that thing you smell.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! (Realises that Ross is in the room.) Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhh, come on!!!
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think she’s here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Wait! Wait-wait! Ross, please!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You want me to take some girl I’ve never met to the opera so you can go to a club and flirt with some guy, hmm, that-that is a toughie.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, she’s looking down the hall. Oh! She looked right at me! Oh wait, you can’t see people through that little hole, can you? (Goes back to the door.) Hello!
Woman: Hello! (Monica screams)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll be right there! (to Ross) Okay, Ross, please come on! I thought we have moved on! I thought we’ve gotten to a place where we could be happy for each other! I mean was that just me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, I’ll do it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh thank you! Thank you, thank you, thank you! (Monica opens the door.) Emily?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m Rachel Green.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Thank goodness.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There’s been a teeny-teeny change in plans. It turns out that I’m not free tonight. So…

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Really?! Well, that’s just lovely, isn’t it? I must’ve missed your call, even though I didn’t leave the flat all day.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well, no I…

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh, no-no-no, that’s not rude! It’s perfectly in keeping with a trip that I’ve already been run down by one of your wiener carts, and been strip-searched at John F. Kennedy Airport, apparently to you people, I look like someone who’s got a balloon full of cocaine stuffed up their bum.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I-I-I think you look great.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Good night, it was very nice to meet you all. (Storms out.)
(Pause)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll get her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Please hurry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t you just love the way they talk?!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, erm, Chandler and Joey’s, the next morning, Monica and Phoebe are eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It kicked! I think the baby kicked!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no wait, oh no, the elastic on my underwear busted.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! I overslept! I was supposed to be on the set a half an hour ago! I gotta get out of here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh wait, Joey, you can’t go like that! You stink!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I know I feel asleep before I could shower and now I don’t have time! They’re just ten blocks away, if I run, I can make it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. Run ten blocks, that’ll help the smell.
(He opens the door to reveal Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey—whoa, slow down. (Gets a whiff of him) No, keep moving. (Joey runs off.) Wow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So? How did it go with Joshua last night?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I didn’t see Joshua last night, but I did punch a girl in the face.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The whole night was horrible, it was pouring down rain, and when I got there, there was no Rachel Green on the list, but there was a Rachel Greep.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! So, did you get to meet her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, there is no Rachel Greep, but then this other girl overheard us and she was all, “I’m Rachel Greep! I’m Rachel Greep!” and he let her right in.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you hit her in the face?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, she was already in, but then this big bitch behind me tried to steal my umbrella, so I clocked her. Ohhh! I can’t believe this, all I wanted was a few hours outside of work to see Joshua, so he can go ahead and start falling in love with me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aww, Pheebs.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, that’s you’re name.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s short for Phoebe?! I thought that was just what we called each other!
(Chandler enters from his bedroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! You’re wearing pants!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s right! Where are the guys? I’m ready to get drunk and see some strippers.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s 9:30 in the morning!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They got a breakfast buffet.
(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello. (Listens) Oh, hey Ross!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, let me talk to him!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh-oh, my God!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, can I just…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shh!! (On phone) Wait, what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s shhing me! It’s my phone and she’s shhing me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shhh!! Please! What’s he saying?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s with Emily at a Bed and Breakfast in Vermont!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Who the hell is Emily—(realises) noooo!!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, erm, Monica and Rachel’s, scene continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: They’re in Vermont!! How could this happen?! (She waves her arms franticly and hits Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How—how did end up in Vermont with that awful witch?! (She hits Chandler again.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe, she doesn’t hit him all the time.
[cut to Ross in Vermont, talking on the phone.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: When we first met her, she was soaking, her feet were wet! Who wouldn’t be miserable? I’m telling you when I got her into a dry pair of shoes, she was a totally different person.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross! Come quickly! There’s a deer just outside eating fruit from the orchard!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve gotta go, there’s a deer just outside eating fruit from the orchard! (He hangs up and runs out.)
[cut back to Chandler and Joey’s.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He had to go, there’s a deer just outside eating fruit from the orchard.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t get this! She was horrible! (She hits Chandler, yet again.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I’m going to go stand over there. (Points and moves into the living room.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why do you care so much anyway?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t care! All right, y’know what I’m just upset that I’m getting nowhere with Joshua that—y’know what still, you do not meet someone and go flitting off to Vermont!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, when you first met Barry, you flitted off to Vail.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, y’know, would you just for once , not remember every…little…thing!! (Storms out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So y’know, uh, when’s he getting back?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A couple of days.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I knew something like this was going to happen. (He starts to take off his pants, revealing that he is still wearing his sweat pants.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?! Chandler! You can’t just go back a phase!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes you can. You’re thinking about time, you can’t go back in time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, look, why don’t you just, why don’t you do your Phase Two strip club thing with us.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, come on, we can be guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No you can’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on! Let us be guys! Maybe we want to be guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t want to be guys, you’d be all hairy and wouldn’t live as long. (Starts to go to his bedroom)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know you, you just stop being such a wuss and get those off and you come with us and watch naked girls dance around!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Starts to cry)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry. (Goes and hugs him)

content.description: Silvercup Studios, Joey is just arriving for his scene.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Joey Tribbiani! I’m here! I’m here!

content.speaker: The A.D
content.text: Calm down, we got time, we’re running a little late.
(Just then, Charlton Heston walks out of his dressing room and starts eating a liquorice whip.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look at that, Charlton Heston eating a liquorice whip!

content.speaker: The A.D
content.text: Yeah, we loves ‘em. I’ve never seen him with—(He gets a whiff of Joey and starts smelling around.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa! Yeah, what the hell is that? What smells so bad?
content.parenthetical: trying to act like he’s not the one that stinks.

content.speaker: The A.D
content.text: You.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, I can see why you think that, but ah, actually, you know who I think it is?

content.speaker: The A.D
content.text: You?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, it’s uh, it’s Heston.

content.speaker: The A.D
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, the man wreaks! Smells like he went on a three day fishing trip and then ate some liquorice.

content.speaker: The A.D
content.text: There’s no way he smells, he’s the only one around here with a shower in his dressing room.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really, a shower huh? And uh, which-which room might that be?

content.speaker: The A.D
content.text: The one with “Heston” on it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Interesting.

content.description: A strip club, the girls are there with Chandler, who isn’t enjoying himself.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’ve got some Ones, you wanna put them in her panties?
content.parenthetical: coming back to the stage and sitting next to Chandler

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No thanks, Mom!
(A man sits down next to Phoebe and lights up a cigarette.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no umm, hi, that-that, you have to put that out, ‘cause I’m pregnant.

content.speaker: The Cigarette Smoking Guy
content.text: Well, maybe you and your baby should go to another strip club.
content.parenthetical: No, not the Cigarette Smoking Man from The X-Files .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ha-ha, it’s not my baby, ha-ha-ha! (He leaves.)
(The dancer finishes and everyone claps.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Very good, (getting up and sliding a One into the dancer’s hot pants) so good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I really, really enjoyed it. Very exotic.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I just checked our messages and Joshua didn’t call. I mean you’d think he’d be worried about me not showing up at his club. Ugh, you know what makes it so much worse, Ross is all happy in Vermont!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on! Look where you are!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: When you get a sec, another round of daiquiris.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Remember, a virgin for me please.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! And don’t let me leave without getting the name of that carpet guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, come on! Y’know what—y’know what, I think I’m just gonna go home and call Kathy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, if you think it will help.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! That was a test! In a couple of hours I’m gonna get really drunk and wanna call Kathy and you guys are gonna have to stop me! And then after that, I’m gonna get so drunk, I’m gonna wanna call Janice

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You should! How is she?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohhh!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think somebody needs another lap dance. (Motions for one.)

content.description: Silvercup studios, Joey is taking a shower in Charlton Heston’s dressing room. Heston enters the room, Joey panics, and walks over to the shower and confronts Joey about the use of his shower.

content.speaker: Charlton Heston
content.text: Hello! Who’s in there? (He opens to curtain to reveal a naked and wet Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How ya doin’?

content.speaker: Charlton Heston
content.text: Who in the hell are you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I guess you wouldn’t believe me if I said I was Kurt Douglas, huh?

content.speaker: Charlton Heston
content.text: Put some pants on kid so I can kick your butt.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no, no, no, wait. You see, I’m an actor, Joey Tribbiani, I’m doing a scene with you today, and well, I stink.

content.speaker: Charlton Heston
content.text: You’re in this picture?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah, I’m one of the cops that won’t work with you ‘cause you a lose cannon. Anyway, look, I’m really sorry, but I stink!

content.speaker: Charlton Heston
content.text: Joey, right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Charlton Heston
content.text: Every actor at one time or another—opp! (Joey tries to sit down next to him and Heston makes him sit somewhere else.) Every actor thinks he stinks, even Lawrence Oliver at sometimes thought he stank, Bob Redford won’t even watch himself.
content.parenthetical: tosses him a towel, motions for him to get out of the shower and sits down on the couch

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no-no-no, you don’t understand…

content.speaker: Charlton Heston
content.text: Listen to me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, yeah.

content.speaker: Charlton Heston
content.text: I don’t know one actor worth his salt that didn’t say at one time or another, “God, I stink!” Hell, I just did a scene out there, first take, I stunk the place up. But, the important thing you must remember, no matter how badly you think you might stink, you must never, ever bust into my dressing room and use my shower! Do you understand me?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes sir! Yes sir, I’m-I’m—(he starts to leave)

content.speaker: Charlton Heston
content.text: Wait a minute! Take your pants.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Oh, yeah.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are returning from the strip club.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, we did okay at the strip club, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, that was great. Thanks to you, the hottest cocktail waitress there is quitting to teach the third grade!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t believe it! He still hasn’t called.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Who, Josh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s Joshua.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What, he doesn’t like Josh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I don’t.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, well I’m gonna put my sweats back on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no! Wait! Wait! Okay, y’know what, you were right, you were right. We really weren’t great at being guys, but you know why? Because we’re girls.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And do you know what girls are really good at?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stripping!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, listening! Sit! Y’know, maybe it would just really, really help if you would just talk.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, come on! What’s going in on in there? (Pats his chest.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. And y’know, if you wanna cry, that’s okay too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, look, I’m gonna have to ask you all to leave.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, forget it. We tried, but Phase Three is a lost cause, Okay? Those strippers were insanely hot, and I couldn’t picture myself with any of them. (Sits back in disgust.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They really were pretty, weren’t they? (Rachel and Phoebe both agree)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I really liked that fighter pilot one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Candy! She was so spunky!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, I think if I were going to be with a woman. (Chandler is intrigued.) It’d, it’d be with someone like Michelle, she was so oh, she was so petite.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: See, I don’t know, for me it would have to Chantal.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Chantal!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my goodness, she had the smoothest skin! I mean when I stuck that dollar bill in her g-string and grazed her thigh…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phase Three! I just achieved Phase Three!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am totally picturing you with all those women!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s-that’s not Phase Three.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m there too!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, are we all together? Like in a group?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stop it! You’re killing me! I think I just moved on to Phase Four!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! What is that? What is that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where I don’t want to have a relationship ever! I just want to have sex with strippers and my friends!!

content.description: Central Perk, the gang is there, minus Ross. Chandler is trying to cheer Joey up about missing Phase Two.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, let me see that smile.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t wanna.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Please?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I wanted to go to the strip club!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, I know, but you’re gonna have plenty of chances. There are literally thousands of women out there just waiting to screw me over.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, all right. (Ross enters.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey—ooh so, how was Vermont?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily is…incredible. I mean there-there are no words to describe it, I mean the whole weekend was like a dream. (Sees Rachel coming back from the bathroom.) Oh! And you! Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! You were so right!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, what you said, about us being in a place where we could finally be happy for each other.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hmm.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I mean, I, I-I admit I-I wasn’t quite there. Y’know, I mean the thought of you and that-that Josh guy…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joshua.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joshua…guy at that club, dancing and having a good time, the thought of it kinda…y’know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But now! I’m there! I’m totally there! I’m-I’m finally where you are!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, thank goodness!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, and-and thank you for Emily.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no problem. I’m so glad I could help. Happy for you. (She playfully punches him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Happy for you. (He punches her back.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, happy for you! (Hits him harder.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler is there and is getting ready to direct a bunch of strippers, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe on what to do in the upcoming orgy of lesbian lust. Yes, it’s a dream sequence, this isn’t cable.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right ladies, here’s what we’re gonna do. (Points to a stripper.) You are gonna take off my clothes. (To another two strippers) You two, go get the oils. (To another stripper) And you just constantly scream at the top of your voice, “Chandler’s the king! Chandler’s the king!”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I wanna be with her, (points to the stripper next to her) I like her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s fine! Go with your instincts, go with your instincts.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, now, what am I doing again?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on! Would you please pay attention, I could wake up at any moment!

content.speaker: The Cigarette Guy
content.text: Hi, I’m Joshua, I’m here to pick up Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no-no, that’ not Joshua.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What do you want from me, I’ve never met the guy. So anyway, Rachel, I’m sorry you can’t stay, (Rachel is upset about leaving the orgy with the cigarette guy.) but the rest of us have a lot of work to do. (The cigarette guy starts rubbing Chandler’s back.) What are you doing? (The guy just nods) All right, listen, I’ve got to wake up!
